title: Human Resource Lead - Remote & Haiti
description:
R0115064
  
Remote
  
Remote, United States
  
Full time
  
  

Amentum, a large government contract company, is seeking a Human Resources Lead to support a pending contract award in Haiti. This will be a remote position, with the possibility of travel to Haiti as needed.
  
  

POSITION SUMMARY
  
  

The Human Resources (HR) Lead will support the HR Manager and Program leadership in accomplishing Amentum contractual requirements successfully for the LOGCAP contract. This includes, but is not limited to:
  
  

Providing proactive and timely HR support as well as guidance focusing on employee relations, company policy and procedure, performance management, and compliance with all host country laws and applicable US laws for all personnel in theatre
  
Being proactive, resourceful, and efficient while maintaining a high level of professionalism and confidentiality
  
Coordinating with Talent Acquisition staff to support and contribute as needed to the recruitment process; creating requisitions, and processing candidates
  
Overseeing onboarding new hires and ensuring that new employees understand the company policies/procedures and benefits
  
Acting as liaison between employees and Amentum Corporate Benefits and Corporate Payroll
  
Conducting investigations and documenting investigations related to employee complaints/problems
  
Drafting employee corrective actions that align with the company policies, practices and culture, and creating performance improvement plans when needed
  
Other duties as assigned by leadership
  
  

QUALIFICATIONS
  
  

Three years of relevant experience
  
Experience working with human resources principles, practices and procedures
  
Minimum of one (1) year of experience in employee relations (including investigations, recommendations, etc.)
  
Experience working with Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS), preferably Workday
  
Must possess and demonstrate solid critical thinking and analytical skills
  
Must regularly demonstrate effective problem solving, conflict resolution, and relationship building skills
  
Demonstrated knowledge of Federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations
  
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; ability to interact with people at every level and to represent the company in a positively
  
Strong writing and documentation skills
  
Highly organized, able to meet deadlines and manage shifting priorities
  
High degree of personal integrity; ability to maintain confidentiality.
  
Must be able to function in an office setting, answer the phone, use office equipment, etc.
  
Strong computer skills, specifically in Microsoft Word and Excel
  
Previous work experience in an austere OCONUS environment with a multi-national workforce
  
Excellent organizational and time management skills
  
Strong computer skills, specifically in Microsoft Word and Excel
  
Valid US or local driver's license and US passport
  
**Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret Clearance. Note:** US Citizenship is required to obtain a Secret Clearance.
  
Ability to successfully pass contract medical requirements and maintain requirements for duration of deployment as required
  
Country visa (as required in line with the U.S. Department of State Foreign Clearance Guide)
  
  

OTHER KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
  
  

Experience providing excellent customer service in supporting contract responsibilities
  
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment handling multiple tasks at a given time and rapidly adapting to changing priorities and schedules and under pressure of deadlines while maintaining performance standards
  
  

EDUCATION
  
  

HS diploma or GED required
  
**Preferred:** Bachelor’s degree in human resources, business administration or related field preferred
  
**Preferred:** GPHR, SHRM-CP or SHRM-SCP, or other related certifications
  
  

WORKING AND LIVING CONDITIONS
  
  

This position may be located in an environment with harsh and dangerous working and living conditions. Employees must be willing and able to perform regular job requirements in this environment. Employees must be willing and able to perform physical activities including, but not limited to, heavy lifting and moving of items, parts, assemblies, and equipment up to the safety regulation maximum; climbing in and out of equipment; crawling; and working outdoors. This includes being able to lift and carry 40 pounds of personal protective equipment for extended periods of time and being capable of running and ‘duck & cover’ during emergencies without putting oneself or others at risk.
  
  

OTHER RESPONSIBILTIES
  
  

Safety - Amentum enforces a safety culture whereby all employees have the responsibility for continuously developing and maintaining a safe work environment. As appropriate, each employee is responsible for completing all training requirements and fulfilling all self-aid/buddy aid responsibilities, participating in emergency response tasks and serving on safety committees and teams.
  
  

Quality - Quality is the foundation for the management of our business and the keystone to our goal of customer satisfaction. It is our policy to consistently provide services that meet customer expectations. Accordingly, each employee must conform to the Amentum Quality Policy and carry out job activities in compliance with applicable Amentum Quality System documents and customer contracts. Each employee must read and understand his/her Quality Management and Customer Satisfaction responsibilities.
  
  

Procedure Compliance - Each employee must read, understand, and implement the general and specific operational, safety, quality and environmental requirements of all plans, procedures and policies pertaining to job.

title: Senior HR Manager
description:
**Senior HR Manager**


Smith.ai is looking for a talented Sr. HR Manager to oversee all aspects of HR for a nimble, 100% remote team. All applicants within the US are welcome with no geographical restrictions as long as you are within 3 hours of the PDT timezone.

**About The Role**


Reporting to the Chief Operation Officer, the Sr. HR Manager will support the people operations of Smith.ai and its growing network of frontline teammates. They will drive all people ops programs for our salaried staff, a team of about 60 individuals across the US, including performance management, benefits, employee relations, and more. This individual will also serve as a trusted advisor and thought partner to the business leaders who support our hourly receptionist teams, a team of about 500 individuals across North America, providing guidance, coaching, and HR strategies to help drive our mission forward. Finally, and almost most importantly, the Sr. HR Manager will champion diversity, inclusiveness, and belonging in the workplace, helping all teammates and managers reach their full potential.


The HR Manager will leverage their expertise in local, state and federal employment law, employee relations, and performance management to lead with empathy while balancing the needs of the business. The ideal candidate should bring a passion for compliance, process, and policy to help our teams build for scale.

**About us**
============


Smith.ai, a high-growth startup founded by ex-Googlers, combines remote-working live agents with artificial intelligence to deliver superior 24/7 customer engagement on behalf of small and medium businesses, primarily through virtual receptionists, sales outreach, and chat. We bring together the best North America-based agents with our proprietary AI technology to help SMBs run more productive, professional, and profitable operations. Smith.ai is a place where culture matters, personal and career growth are encouraged, and work-from-home is a way of life.

 **What you will do:**

* Lead our HR practices, overseeing all aspects of full-time, hourly, and contingent workforce matters
* Create and administer talent enrichment programs to develop leaders from within
* Implement global HR policies, practices and programs while ensuring compliance with local, state and federal regulations
* Respond with accuracy and timeliness to employee inquiries and issues related to compensation, benefits and leaves of absence
* Design, implement and manage HR Technology to automate, reduce, and eliminate processes that delight our teams
* Lead our benefit plan design and partner with our brokers and vendors to ensure cost efficiencies and competitiveness that will attract and retain top talent
* Oversee and improve upon our annual and bi-annual performance review process
* Initiate and supervise the implementation and advancement of human resources processes by identifying areas of opportunity where automation can occur to scale existing manual processes
* Partner with relevant cross-functional teams to draft and maintain various employment, contractor, vendor and third-party agreements
* Create quantitative and qualitative insights to shape and strengthen our talent priorities


**Our ideal candidate:**
========================

* 5+ years of HR experience; ideally in a high-growth environment with between 50 - 200 people
* Comes with strong HR fundamentals, understanding of the functional side of the people space, such as compliance and employment law requirements, benefits, HR technology, and more
* Is experienced managing contingent and hourly staff, familiar PEO/EOR providers
* Has strong project management skills with the capacity to self-manage progress against milestones with a high degree of accountability and urgency
* Believes in quality, consistency, and empathy as you drive your everyday work and projects, strengthening HR's partnership with the organization's leaders and employees
* Has experience and passion for building strong and effective cross-functional relationships to ensure business processes are optimized
* Enjoys a fast pace of work and changing cadences; role modeling the ability and benefit of being flexible and adaptable


We are an equal opportunity employer and believe diversity makes teams better and that discrimination based on race, gender, or anything else is self-defeating.  

  

This is a full-time position with a base salary that ranges between $110,000 - $140,000 per year. In addition to salary, you are eligible for equity and a competitive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k, and PTO.

title: Regional Senior HR Manager (West Coast Retail Stores)
description:
QUESTIONNAIRE-6-38  

03**Serving the needs of all families with young children,** Carter’s Inc. is the largest North American apparel retailer exclusively for babies and young children, encompassing Carter’s, OshKosh B’gosh, Skip\\*Hop and Little Planet brands. Meaningful work, constant learning, genuine people, and a community guided by core values that promote inclusion and innovation is in everything we do. There are many reasons to build your career at Carter's.


**HOW YOU’LL MAKE AN IMPACT:**  

The Regional Senior HR Manager is a passionate HR leader committed to building an inclusive environment that attracts and develops people of all backgrounds. They are responsible for providing solutions, thought-partnership, and business talent strategies to Field Leaders. Responsible for coaching leaders, setting the HR vision, and managing all day-to-day HR activities. The HR leader is a change champion, whose role is both strategic and hands-on to provide full cycle HR support. The role will influence teams to translate business needs into a people-first agenda and build trust in every interaction by modeling Carter’s core values.


This role reports to the Senior Director, HR Retail and must be based on the West Coast (AZ, CA, CO, ID, OR, WA). Will require travel up to 30% of the time within the region and/or to our HQ in Atlanta.


Employee Relations (50%):

* Develop, advise, and implement organizational strategies to elevate HR / Operational effectiveness
* Partner with Regional Vice President/Director and District leaders to review, manage and optimize team performance through Performance Management, Succession Planning and Employee Development
* Conducts internal investigations and/or employee concerns on workplace situations and prepares all required documentation with a focus on issue resolution within assigned region/area
* Leads in partnership with retail teams the Positive Employee Relations strategy to all employees and ensures all employees voices are heard
* Partners with managers on the development of corrective action and implementation of performance improvement plans
* Coaches and advises Regionals, District Managers and Store Management on the performance counselling process and partners with them on solutions at all employee levels
* Coaches and drives accountability of Leaders with the annual and midyear performance review process
* Promote knowledge and understanding of Company policies and of relevant employment laws through coaching, presentations, and training
* Collectively partners on innovative and long-term solutions to prevent occurrence of issues


Talent Development / Planning (30%):

* Execute recruiting strategy by organizing and directing efforts, including sourcing, screening, and interviewing applicants for management positions
* Partners with Regional on the development and execution of succession plan at DM and store level to ensure both internal and external pipeline of candidates meet the demands of the business
* Drives focus to consistently raise the bar for identifying talent, hiring and developing leaders who cultivate our culture
* Partner with the talent acquisition team on developing a recruitment strategy focused on attracting top talent and diversity through targeted outreach
* Supports the Talent team and Field leaders on pipeline generation and compelling marketing of the organization and job opportunities
* Partners with stakeholders to manage the tools, processes and communications involved in the successful design, preparation, and delivery of talent programs
* Proactively provides and seeks out well-thought out, actionable feedback and career development opportunities for District Managers and Store Management
* Takes an active lead with learning and development to drive Leadership Development programs and ensure successful retention and succession


HR Process / Operations (20%):

* Review and analyze business metrics including data on retention and employee experience in order to recommend systemic improvements
* Fully leverage data and predictive people analytics to drive insight and support the business
* Support Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Initiatives through the promotion of education, brand visibility and organizational design that fosters professional opportunities and growth for all
* Support and contribute to change efforts for business initiatives
* Successfully monitor the "pulse" of the employees to ensure a high level of employee engagement
* Drive recommendations, accountability and changes to positively impact engagement and retention
* Meeting support at company/regional/district level; Content development & Platform speaking

**WE’D LOVE TO HEAR FROM YOU IF:**  

Must have:

* Flexible availability with ability to travel up to 30% of the time
* Minimum of 10 years of professional experience in employee relations, and/or human resources
* Retail industry experience is required; retail management experience is a plus (multi-site preferred)
* 10+ years People Management experience; preferably in a fast-paced Retail environment
* Valid driver’s license


Preferred skills and experience:

* Bachelor’s Degree strongly preferred
* Bilingual (English/Spanish) preferred

**OUR TEAM MEMBERS:**

* Lead Courageously: Have a strong sense of personal values that align with our Company values
* Collaborates Broadly: Build cooperation, trust, and thrive in a consensus driven environment
* Customer Focus: Proactively seek opportunities to leverage data and fact-based insights to serve customers and/or internal clients
* Drive Growth: Set aggressive goals and implement plans precisely
* Cultivates Innovation: Respectfully challenge the "we’ve always done it this way" mentality and explore new ways to achieve desired outcomes

**MAKE A CAREER AT CARTER’S:**

* Career Development: Success starts from within, and we have several paths from which you can choose to enhance your career evolution. From Carter’s University to Toastmasters to mentorship programs and more, we encourage you to utilize these tools to elevate your professional prowess.


Compensation for this position ranges from $100,000 - $160,000 annually based on skills and experience.


#LI-Remote


Carters is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: HR Manager
description:

We are looking for an HR Manager to oversee all aspects of human resources practices and processes. The HR Manager is the go-to person for all employee-related issues. HR Manager duties will involve managing activities such as job design, recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training & development and talent management. title: Human Resources Senior Manager - HRBP Global Oncology Teams
description:
**HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?**


If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that reach over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of.

**Human Resources Senior Manager - HRBP Global Oncology Teams**
---------------------------------------------------------------

**Live**
--------

**What you will do**


Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role as a Human Resources Senior Manager at Amgen, you'll oversee several HR functions in a strategic capacity. Your responsibilities will include planning and implementing HR strategies, leading talent acquisition efforts, driving performance management processes, and maintaining employee relations. You'll also ensure adherence to labor laws and regulations, and provide guidance on complex HR issues.

* This position will report to the Director HR, who oversees the strategic partnership with these two business groups within Amgen’s R&D (Development and Oncology) organization.
* This role provides the opportunity to develop solutions to a variety of complex global HR challenges in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
* This HRBP will use well-developed HR consulting skills to help their business clients achieve key business objectives and increase the effectiveness of their organization.
* They will coach clients on a variety of HR and business-related issues to effect change in the organization.
* Additional responsibilities include leading, in partnership with the relevant HR centers of expertise; leadership development, talent management, compensation strategies, engagement and retention, culture, and ongoing organizational design/workforce strategy initiatives.

**Accountabilities**
--------------------

* Consult with business leaders to identify HR challenges and opportunities and recommend thoughtful and sound solutions that fit the needs of the global clients and achieve business objectives.
* Coach clients on a variety of HR and business-related issues to increase effectiveness and improve work culture.
* Lead, in partnership with the relevant HR partners (COE and in Countries) development, talent management, compensation strategies, engagement and retention, culture, and ongoing organizational design/workforce strategy initiatives.
* Participate as an active member of the functional senior leadership teams.
* Develop and drive solutions, initiatives and programs that meet customer needs while remaining aligned with global strategies.

**Win**
-------

**What we expect of you**


We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The savvy Human Resources professional we seek will possess these qualifications.

**Basic Qualifications:**
-------------------------


Doctorate degree & 2 years Human Resources experience


OR


Master’s degree & 4 years of Human Resources experience


OR


Bachelor’s degree & 6 years of Human Resources experience


OR


Associate’s degree & 10 years of Human Resources experience

**Or**
------


High school diploma / GED & 12 years of Human Resources experience

**Preferred Qualifications:**
-----------------------------

* MBA or Master's degree with emphasis in such areas as organizational development, management, human resources, employee/labor relations, or equivalent.
* 8+ years of progressively complex/strategic HR experience, including organizational effectiveness, staff relations, compensation, talent development, and recruitment.
* Demonstrated ability to understand business needs and develop strategic and practical solutions to tangible business challenges, sound knowledge of applicable employment laws, regulations, and business practices related to the field of Human Resources.
* Proven ability to prioritize multiple competing priorities, adapt to constantly evolving demands, and possess an intellectual curiosity, desire and ability to understand the business.
* Strong analytical, problem solving, consulting, and project management skills.
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.
* Demonstrated ability to interact with and influence all levels of management, and executives.
* Demonstrated ability to partner well with other HR and business functions.

**Thrive**
----------

**What you can expect of us**


As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.


Amgen offers a Total Rewards Plan comprising health and welfare plans for staff and eligible dependents, financial plans with opportunities to save towards retirement or other goals, work/life balance, and career development opportunities including:

* Comprehensive employee benefits package, including a Retirement and Savings Plan with generous company contributions, group medical, dental and vision coverage, life and disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts.
* A discretionary annual bonus program, or for field sales representatives, a sales-based incentive plan
* Stock-based long-term incentives
* Award-winning time-off plans and bi-annual company-wide shutdowns
* Flexible work models, including remote work arrangements, where possible

**Apply now**

**for a career that defies imagination**


Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

title: Manager - Talent Relations - REMOTE
description:
**We're a Little Different**  

  

Our mission is clear. We bring to life a healing ministry through our compassionate care and exceptional service.
  

  

At Mercy, we believe in careers that match the unique gifts of unique individuals - careers that not only make the most of your skills and talents, but also your heart. Join us and discover why Modern Healthcare Magazine named us in its "Top 100 Places to Work."  

  

**Overview:**  

  

**This is a REMOTE position.**  

  

This position will lead Talent Relations Advisors supporting the Human Resources (HR) service model for Mercy in a virtual setting. This person will play a pivotal role in leading a group of co-workers that provide a world-class HR experience to our leaders, managers, and co-workers. This individual will bring expertise in basic Employee Relations matters and HR system navigation, along with generalist knowledge across the HR domain. Service will be provided through different channels including a contact center, case management via a Human Capital Management (HCM) portal, chat and even mail. This individual must have the capability to develop and maintain positive relationships with all levels of co-workers up to the highest level of leadership within the Mercy organization. Knowledge of the current HCM and call center technology is preferred. Maintains a high level of confidentiality and performs duties in a manner consistent with Mercy's mission, values, and service standards. Strong people management skills are a mandatory requirement of this role to deliver a Best in Class experience to our co-workers.  

  

This position must also provide advanced knowledge coworker relations, benefits, compensation and/or expert knowledge, including complex and escalated issues that may not be able to be handled in one call to the Talent Relations Team. Works closely with other Talent Relations leaders, Senior Advisors and Consultants to ensure appropriate collaboration and transition of complex talent relations cases for timely and effective review and resolution.  

  

Lead co-workers whose primary responsibilities are to provide HR generalist service.  

  

Provide training, performance, and process improvement efforts to drive operational excellence and meet departmental goals and standards.  

  

Daily management of service administration via technology and people management of the Talent Relations team. Extensive use of multiple systems (examples include HCM system, UKG, Cisco Finesse, etc.) is required to accurately maintain, communicate, and report out on Talent Relations operations for the entire Ministry.  

  

Manage escalated situations and provide leaders with advice, counsel, and recommended courses of action on issues of low to high complexity, based on operating guidelines, policies and applicable laws.  

  

Assist co-workers of all levels in appropriate resolution of co-worker relations issues and conduct investigations for a variety of issues independently ensuring all practices are efficient, equitable and compliant using Mercy legal standards.  

  

Develop and maintain processes and documentation supporting HR service administration.  

  

Help identify trends and opportunity for improvement based on case types and co-worker/leader behavior patterns.  

  

**Qualifications:**  

* **Experience:** 5+ years in a Human Resources function. 2+ years of leadership experience preferably in a call/support center environment.
* **Required Education:** Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Management, Human Resources or equivalent work experience plus college work in related field
* **Certifications:** SHRM CP or SCP preferred
* **Other:** Advanced computer knowledge and skills. Excellent oral, written, and presentation skills. Strong supervisory and decision making skills. Strong customer service orientation. Ability to work collaboratively with others. Ability to work with and preserve confidential information. Ability to convey and project a professional image to co-workers and leaders. Excellent knowledge of legal requirements and government reporting regulations affecting human resources functions. Demonstrated high level of competency in the areas of employee relations, selection/recruiting, counseling, performance management, benefits and training a plus.

  

**We Offer Great Benefits:**  

  

Day-one comprehensive health, vision and dental coverage, PTO, tuition reimbursement and employer-matched retirement funds are just a few of the great benefits offered to eligible co-workers, including those working 32 hours or more per pay period!  

  

**We're bringing to life a healing ministry through compassionate care.**  

  

At Mercy, our supportive community will be behind you every step of your day, especially the tough ones. You will have opportunities to pioneer new models of care and transform the health care experience through advanced technology and innovative procedures. We're expanding to help our communities grow. Join us and be a part of it all.  

  

**What Makes You a Good Match for Mercy?**  

  

Compassion and professionalism go hand-in-hand with us. Having a positive outlook and a strong sense of advocacy is in perfect step with our mission and vision. We're also collaborative and unafraid to do a little extra to deliver excellent care - that's just part of our commitment. If that sounds like a good fit for you, we encourage you to apply.

title: Senior Human Resources Manager
description:
**Position: Senior Human Resources Manager**



Department: Human Resources



Location: Remote, United States (Pennsylvania, Maryland, Virginia candidates preferred)



Reports to: Managing Director



Residency Requirement: United States [must be authorized to work in the U.S.]



Travel: 0-10%



Potential Career Progression: Director of Human Resources

 **About Us**



The KonTerra Group exists to support the health and effectiveness of organizations and their people. With a focus on supporting organizations working in challenging environments, we develop solutions that sharpen clarity, strengthen resilience, and incorporate learning in the workplace such as short-term counseling, critical incident management services, executive coaching, organizational resilience, strategic and programmatic evaluations, and more. Our government, NGO and private sector clients are diligently supported by a team of seasoned professionals who are passionate about the work we do.

 **The Opportunity**



The Senior Human Resources Manager leads and directs the functions of the Human Resources (HR) department including overseeing compensation and benefits administration, talent management, HR compliance, and employee relations and development. In a growing company (fewer than 50 employees), the Senior HR Manager will strengthen HR functions to support the company’s growth, while creating a work environment that supports employee well-being and engagement. The successful candidate will report to the Managing Director and collaborate with executive leadership to promote KonTerra’s vision and values across the workforce.


*This is a remote, full-time role that will typically operate during EST (Eastern Standard Time) business hours* *and perform these, and other essential duties as required:*

 **What You’ll Do**



HR Operations, Strategy and Management:


* Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with overall business strategy
* Support current and future business needs through development, engagement, and motivation of KonTerra employees.
* Develop clear policies and ensure policy awareness
* Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in human resources, talent management, and employment law; apply this knowledge to communicate changes in policy, practice, and resources to executive leadership.
* Supervise full-time HR Generalist.
* Advise and support full-time Recruiter working under another line manager.

  



Compliance:


* Develop and provide HR policy guidance and interpretation in support of an inclusive and equitable culture that allows KonTerra to attract talented professionals.
* Monitor and ensure the company’s compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices; review and modify policies and practices to maintain compliance.
* Maintain and report on workplace health and safety compliance matters
* Manage annual OFCCP compliance and reporting as necessary, such as VETS-4212, EEO-1, and any other reports necessary based on the size of the organization or contracts won.

  



Sourcing and Recruitment:


* Manage the sourcing and recruitment process required to achieve business goals and support company growth.
* Manage full life cycle recruitment (post, source, prescreen, schedule, background, references, offer, onboarding, etc.).
* Ensure new hires are fully oriented to the organization post-hire
* Create and maintain an environment of equal employment opportunity, diversity and competitive advantage in support of the company's diversity and equity goals.

  



Employee Development and Employee Relations:


* Provide high level advice and guidance to managers and staff to support effective feedback and staff development.
* Maintain and execute the performance management system, including current job descriptions, standards of performance and performance evaluation instruments.
* Oversee learning and development programs that enhance employee skills, career growth, and leadership development.
* Manage employee grievances, conduct investigations, and assist managers and their staff with conflict resolution as necessary.

  



Compensation and Benefits:


* Maintain compensation and benefits programs that support the organization’s ability to attract, retain, and motivate employees, while ensuring internal equity and external competitiveness.
* Manage external partners such as benefits vendors, and insurance brokers

  


**The Skills and Experience You’ll Need**


* Must have at least seven years of relevant Human Resources experience, including two years of experience managing staff.
* Demonstrated experience working with small organizations to mature their human resources operations.
* Excellent leadership, consultation, mentoring, and customer service skills.
* Thorough knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations.

* Experience designing, developing and supporting organization-wide talent management programs that cover performance management, talent development, coaching, succession planning, and relationship management.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Demonstrated commitment to building equitable and inclusive cultures.
* Comfort using Microsoft Office and Google Workspace platform to communicate and collaborate.
* Working knowledge of an ATS/HRIS (Applicant Tracking and Human Resources Information System), preferably BambooHR.

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field required; Master’s degree preferred.
* Current HR credentials SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP, PHR, or SPHR highly preferred.

  


**Your application must include**


* Current CV / resume
* Cover letter (maximum of two pages) that speaks to your interest in this position and includes responses to (1) HR's role in nurturing culture and values within a small company; and (2) strengthening performance management of a geographically distributed workforce.

  


**Your application will stand out if you have**


* Experience working in the international humanitarian and development sector.
* Experience working for a U.S. government contractor preferred, knowledge of USAID contracts highly preferred.

At KonTerra, it is not typical for an* *individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are* *dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current* *range is $100,000 to $120,000. The actual salary offered for this role will be based on a variety of* *factors, including location, internal equity and the candidate’s qualifications and professional* *experience.*

title: Employee and Labor Relations Manager
description:
**TO APPLY FOR THIS ROLE YOU MUST APPLY USING THE LINK BELOW:** 

**https://portal.jobworx.ai/sal-hmd/jobs/M8Jzx3zWEP**

**Job Description**

The role of Labor Relations Manager is vital to enhancing our company's internal labor dynamics. This position involves spearheading efforts to foster a forward-thinking labor relations atmosphere, focusing on risk management, developing and implementing training programs related to labor, addressing external union activities, overseeing contract discussions and management, formulating strategies for internal crisis communication, and managing relevant projects within our dynamic, fast-growing cannabis enterprise. Candidates should bring a minimum of 7 years' experience in traditional labor relations or labor law. This role reports to the Senior Labor Counsel and collaborates closely with the teams in Retail, Consumer Packaged Goods (manufacturing/wholesale), and Human Resources to maintain and promote positive workplace relations. While experience in the cannabis sector is not required, a strong commitment to making a significant impact in this evolving industry is essential.

The position allows for remote work or being based at our headquarters in Chicago, Illinois. It includes up to 50% travel to support our operations across 15 states and address urgent issues as they arise.

**Principal Duties**

* Cultivate and maintain a supportive work environment free from third-party influence.
* Work closely with the Labor Counsel to devise and execute data-driven strategies aiding the company's growth across the nation.
* Independently manage the response to external union interventions, whether proactive or reactive.
* Serve as the chief representative of the company in managing workforce crises.
* Lead the risk evaluation process, ensuring timely resolution and mitigation of potential vulnerabilities.
* Proactively identify and address potential issues to prevent escalation.
* Implement and propagate labor relations strategies across the company.
* Build and sustain relationships within the labor sector.
* Lead negotiations for initial and renewal contract discussions.
* Direct the creation, implementation, and ongoing refinement of training programs.
* Spearhead additional projects such as policy updates, monitoring workforce trends, and adopting industry best practices.
* Coordinate and guide internal teams in labor relations activities.
* Ensure adherence to the National Labor Relations Act and relevant legislation.
* Work in partnership with HR and Employee Relations teams to develop and enforce proactive employee relations programs to minimize risks.
* Manage labor agreement administration, offer guidance on disciplinary actions and contract interpretations, and support in grievance resolution.
* Conduct investigations into grievance arbitrations as needed.
* Create and maintain tools and procedures for labor project management.
* Assist in the preparation and presentation of PowerPoint presentations.
* Manage the Labor Relations SharePoint site, ensuring it remains current.

**Additional Duties:**

* Foster strong relationships with both internal and external parties.
* Engage in the development of company policies.
* Keep informed on best practices for employee engagement and labor trends.
* Understand Labor Peace Agreements.
* Maintain up-to-date documentation of board charges, grievance awards, and briefs.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience, with a Master’s Degree or Juris Doctor being preferred.
* At least 7 years of experience in labor relations within the private sector, preferably in a unionized setting.
* Experience in labor relations within regulated industries such as cannabis, alcohol, tobacco, or pharmaceuticals is advantageous.
* Capable of supporting management during labor organizing campaigns.
* Must have a broad understanding of labor laws, the U.S. government, regulatory environments, and current labor union developments.
* Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.
* Willingness to travel approximately 50% of the time.
* Skilled in explaining complex issues in an understandable manner to all company levels.
* Proficient in project management and technology, including Microsoft Office, SharePoint, and Adobe.
* Must exhibit accuracy, attention to detail, and confidentiality.

**Additional Requirements**

* Successful completion of any required background checks.
* Compliance with all legal and company regulations for working in the industry is mandatory.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,830.88 - $55,194.17 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Regional HR Manager- Western United States (Remote)
description:
**Who We Are**



At OBE, together, we build excellence every day… We are driven by our passion to lead our industry and build a sustainable future, we focus on exceeding customer expectations and delivering innovative solutions. We succeed through the dedication of our empowered teams and partners who fuel our ambition to achieve excellence in the markets where we have a right to win.



We believe **safety, integrity, performance culture, teamwork, customer centricity**, and **agility** are at the core of who we are and how we operate each day to achieve success.


**Summary**



The Regional Human Resources Manager provides business partner leadership to multiple operations, logistics and/or functional teams, while also being responsible for leading and developing multiple HR Teams that are responsible for HR Business Partnership, HR operations administration, and professional and production talent acquisition. The role is responsible for developing continuous improvement projects and activities to improve organizational effectiveness, enhance value, and remove obstacles to business performance to enable the business to achieve its performance targets. This role also increases responsibility for transforming the organization’s culture and driving HR functional excellence and process improvement for a multi-site operation.


**This position will be based in Western United States with a preference for Dallas, Phoenix or Denver,** and traveling to support facilities throughout the region. Travel between 25-30% in the first year of employment would be expected.



Come build with this industry leader!


**Here’s What You’ll Get to Do**


* Define organizational effectiveness goals, develop performance metrics and implement effective people processes to drive business results within regional sites, in alignment with the company’s values and its vision to bring out each person’s best in order to be the best together.
* Serve as a close business partner with Plant Managers, General managers, Sr. Managers and/or Vice Presidents on all human resources matters, including providing counsel and support to managers and line leaders regarding talent acquisition, employee engagement and retention, diversity, employee relations, performance management, team building, coaching and development, succession planning, compensation, legal and regulatory compliance and site safety, security and crisis management.
* Serve as a member of the Regional Human Resources Manager team supporting North American operations to deliver human capital strategies and implement both field and corporate initiatives.
* Support the deployment of cyclical HR processes by fostering complete leader engagement, focus and commitment through coaching, training and robust communications.
* Serve as a vital link between local operations and corporate teams, fostering collaboration between local HR teams, corporate HR functions, operations leadership, and across teams within the regional facilities being supported.
* Drive continuous process improvement and simplification activities within HR and across the business. Apply Lean practices in the daily management of the HR team and serve as a role model for the rest of the operations team and the broader HR organization. Be accountable for the HR team’s participation on corporate sponsored Toyota Production Systems (TPS) deployment and other project teams, providing personal leadership and involvement where needed to model the way.
* Strengthen the HR leadership pipeline and build HR capability by acquiring, developing and inspiring great talent.
* Lead the development and implementation of HR strategies that support operations, supply chain, corporate functional business groups and corporate HR strategic initiatives across multiple manufacturing facilities and/or functional groups.
* Responsible for leading or coaching HR and leaders to develop strong community relations and initiatives that develops the location’s brand and community awareness.


**Here’s What We’re Looking For**


* Strategic business thinker with the demonstrated ability to understand multiple plant and functional business goals, recommend new approaches, programs, policies and processes that yield business/engagement improvement.
* Demonstrated ability to support and lead large and small change initiatives across multiple plants and functions using change management and communications principles and methods.
* Experience & comfort with a fast-paced, complex & changing work environment & the ability to manage multiple & shifting priorities simultaneously, with an orientation toward delivering results.
* Excellent interpersonal, verbal and presentation skills with the ability and passion to engage with others authentically, establish trust, build long-lasting relationships - influence at all levels.
* Strong organizational and time management skills; multi-tasking and prioritizing, planning work activities efficiently to meet deadlines and high-level goals; managing multiple projects simultaneously.


**Experience and Qualifications, You Will Need For Success:**


* Bachelor’s Degree with 7+ years of business partner and people leadership experience, preferably in a manufacturing or distribution environment
* A result-oriented individual who assumes ownership of his/her work with a strong sense of urgency, excellent organizational skills & attention to detail; ability to follow up and execute quickly and efficiently
* Ability to build and maintain trust-based, collaborative relationships and influence others
* Demonstrates initiative, tenacity and the ability to think critically to reach the best solution
* A confident communicator (both verbally and in writing), strong judgement, proactive and approachable
* Effective problem solving, process improvement and critical thinking skills
* Team-oriented with the ability to flex in support of timelines and deliverables
* Working knowledge of MS Windows and HRIS systems necessary to be effective
* Travel requirements varies based on need, approximately 30%
* Bilingual in Spanish, preferred


**What OBE Offers You**


* Competitive pay
* Paid time off
* 10 Holidays (inclusive of 2 floating holidays)
* Market competitive 401(k) match
* Industry-leading medical, dental, and vision benefits
* Short-term and long-term disability coverage
* Life Insurance


**About OBE**



At OBE, we believe the work of our employees truly matters. From apartments in New York to office buildings in Toronto, stadiums in Dallas, and universities in Atlanta, our teams contribute to the projects that shape the world where we live, work, heal, and play.



OBE delivers products to a broad customer base of architects, glaziers, contractors, and developers serving diversified residential and commercial construction end-markets. With over 6,700 employees, we operate 82 manufacturing and distribution facilities in five countries.



If you want to help us build something great- we invite you to take the first step and apply today! Once you click apply now, you will be brought to our official employment application. Please complete your online profile and it will be sent to the hiring manager for consideration. Our system allows you to view and track your status 24 hours a day. Thank you for your interest!



OBE is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer.



EOE/Vet/Disability-If you want to know more, please click on this link.



Oldcastle BuildingEnvelope is an E-Verify Employer.



#OBE


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
***Location: Remote***

***Schedule: Full-Time (40 hours/week)***

***Salary: $80,000 - $95,000 annually***

At Leading Retirement Solutions (LRS) our mission is to empower all businesses with the economic independence required to help their employees save for a secure retirement. If this aligns with your values, and you possess the skill set to thrive in a fast paced and often changing work environment, we would love for you to join our organization of experts!

We recommend and implement 401(k)s, 403(b)s, Defined Benefit Plans, SEP & Simple IRAs, ROBS, ESOPS, Church Plans, and even retirement plans for Cannabis companies. Through our open architecture recordkeeping services, we provide investment advisors, managers, plan sponsors and participants access to traditional and non- traditional investments.

**Essential Job Duties** 

* Align strategies in areas of responsibility to support a strong organizational culture, employer brand and value proposition which supports our position as the employer of choice.
* Develop programs and initiatives that recognize and reinforce behaviors that exemplify organizational values of commitment to quality, service and collaboration.
* Continually advance and implement people strategies to support organization growth while maintaining and enhancing a positive organizational culture.
* Incorporate strong change management principles and practices and communication into each strategic initiative.
* Oversee strong employee relations practices to support a safe, healthy and positive workplace.
* Develop formal and informal engagement assessment tools and use data to develop programs and action plans that enhance employee engagement, inclusion, satisfaction and connection (both with the organization and with other employees).
* Process multi- state payroll.
* Develop formal plan for annual or quarterly performance reviews.
* Develop policies and programs to support a diverse and inclusive culture that aligns with the company’s broader interests and objectives.·
* Ensure compliance with federal and local governments employment and labor laws.
* Develop the total rewards strategy to support the company’s objective of being the Employer of Choice; customize plans for each operational segment to include base compensation, incentives, benefits, and other rewards.
* Regularly evaluate the market to maintain competitive compensation and benefits programs and practices; and evaluate internal data to assess equity and value.
* Create and evaluate the effectiveness of pay-for-performance strategies to include bonuses, incentives and variable pay plans that support key business performance objectives.
* Maintain compliance with ordinances and regulations; serves as a plan administrator and/or plan fiduciary as designated.
* Evaluate current healthcare benefits plan (medical, dental, vision, etc.) to determine if another plan would be beneficial and be able to lead the charge and implement.
* Collaborate with executive team, consultants and vendors to develop programs and policies that support the company’s position as an Employer of Choice.
* Provide executive leadership in administrative areas of HR service delivery including payroll, workforce management (centralized scheduling, timekeeping), reporting and analysis, leave management, workers’ compensation and safety, ensuring timely, accurate and supportive service to the employee population.·
* Lead selection and optimization of HRMS (Human Resource Management System) / HRIS (Human resource information system) and support systems to provide an innovative employee experience; provides alternatives and support for employees with varying digital fluency.
* Provide key data, reporting and analysis to operational leaders to enable decision-making that positively impacts broader organizational objectives and workforce strategies.
* Provide strong support and collaboration with leaders in adapting organizational design to meet evolving needs and objectives.
* Responsible for posting open positions internally on company website, job boards, interviewing, qualifying candidates, coordinating, and scheduling interviews with hiring managers, negotiating and extending offers, conducting reference and background checks, onboarding new employees, dispositioning applicants.
* Provide support and collaboration with leaders to meet hiring needs and team build outs.
* Additional duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications** 

* Bachelor’s degree in business, human resources or a related field.
* 5-7 years of HR experience with a focus on talent acquisition, recruiting, total rewards, HR systems and analysis, payroll, compensation, performance review programs, management training and compliance programs and employee / labor relations.
* Previous experiences in leading workforce and people strategies in an operationally diverse organization.
* Knowledgeable of wage and hour laws across the US given the nuances state to state, FMLA, ADA, FLSA, DOL, OSHA, HIPAA, EEOC, COBRA and other labor and employment laws.
* Enthusiastic and energetic thought leader who thrives in a collaborative environment and has a creative, engaging, and people-focused attitude.
* Creative problem solver who can navigate current challenges while strategically planning for periods of growth and work in a very fast-paced, ever-evolving environment.
* Superb interpersonal skills with the ability to develop and maintain effective relationships with senior business leaders, managers, and peers.
* Exceptional written and oral communication skills with strong negotiation and influencing skills.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* PHR, SPHR, SHRM-CP or SHRM-SCP preferred.
* Experience in the retirement plan industry.

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**

* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear.
* The employee is frequently required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms.
* The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
* The work environment is usually an indoor setting with infrequent exposure to outside elements. This position requires less than 5% of travel.
* The person in this position occasionally needs to move about inside a home office environment to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc.
* Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery such as a printer.

**We Offer Great Benefits!**

* Choice between 4 medical plans
* Dental, Vision and Accident Insurance
* 3+ Weeks of Paid Time off (PTO) Starting
* Paid Holidays
* Employer sponsored 401(k) Plan + Employer matching contributions
* Performance bonuses
* Financial support for ongoing education and credentialing
* Great, casual working environment with casual dress.
* 100% Employer Paid Work from Home Setup
* Flexible Scheduling

LRS will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening.*

If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to careers@leadingretirement.com General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here.*

title: People Experience Lead
description:
Position Summary:

The HR/People Experience Manager will serve as a trusted advisor to all employees. This role will partner with levels of management to deliver value-added HR solutions with a focus on maximizing employee engagement, employee retention, and employee performance in addition to effectively managing employee relations concerns.
Duties and Responsibilities:
* Responsible for the service delivery model and end-to-end process framework for the Business units; driving continuous improvement through benchmarking, to provide efficient, effective, and compliant People Experience, with an employee driven culture
* Provides day-to-day performance management guidance to line management (e.g., coaching, counseling, disciplinary actions)
* Provides HR policy guidance and interpretation to employees and managers and makes best practices recommendations while ensuring compliance throughout the organization
* Maintains in-depth knowledge of federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations thereby reducing legal risks. Partners with the legal department as needed
* Maintains compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws, regulations and recommended best practices
* Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues. Conducts effective, thorough, and objective investigations
* Oversees and responsible for Family Medical Leave Act (FMLA) claims processes and regularly conducts audits with the 3rd party administrator to ensure consistency and compliance
* Administers Americans with Disabilities Act Amendments Act (ADAAA) interactive process to include initial conversation with employee, reviewing medical certification, evaluating requested/recommended accommodations, partnering, and communicating with department leadership and Safety Dept. to determine reasonable accommodations, and writing determination letters to employees
* Works closely with management and employees to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention
* Handles employment-related inquiries from employees and supervisors, escalating as needed to the appropriate staff
* Supports the implementation of human resources initiatives and programs
* Supports the process of constructive and timely performance evaluations, and annual compensation reviews
* Other duties as assigned

  

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  

While performing the responsibilities of the job, the employee is required to talk and hear. The employee is often required to remain in a stationary position for a significant amount of the workday and frequently use their hands and fingers to handle or feel in order to access, input, and retrieve information from the computer and other office productivity devices. The employee is regularly required to move about the office and around the corporate campus. The employee is regularly required to stand, walk, reach with arms and hands, climb or balance, and to stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. Vision abilities required by this job include close vision.
Knowledge and Skills:
* Working knowledge of core human resources disciplines with emphasis on leaves of absence, corrective action, performance management, employee engagement, retention, and employee relations
* Ability to demonstrate strong working knowledge of employment laws, including but not limited to, Title VII, ADAAA, FMLA, FLSA, and EEOC regulations to maintain compliance with local, state, and federal laws
* Specific applicable knowledge of New Jersey State Leave Laws
* Proficient in interpreting and applying the appropriate sections of applicable laws, guidelines, regulations, ordinances, and policies
* Excellent attention to detail
* Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Skills-Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook
* Highly adaptable, demonstrating agility in navigating dynamic environments and complex challenges
* Customer Focus: Ability to build strong customer relationships and deliver customer centric solutions
* Optimizes Work Processes: Know the most effective and efficient processes to get things done, with a focus on continuous improvement
* Collaborates: Builds partnerships and works collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives
* Resourcefulness: Secures and deploys resources effectively and efficiently
* Manages Complexity: Makes sense of complex, high quality, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems
* Ensures Accountability: Holds self and other accountable to meet commitment
* Situational Adaptability: Adapts approach and demeanor in real time to match shifting demands of different situations
* Communicates Effectively: Develops and delivers multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences


Experience and Qualifications:
* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or University (Human Resources or Business preferred)
* 5-8 years of Human Resources experience with an emphasis on employee relations and coaching entry level leaders
* Previous experience working in a manufacturing environment preferred
* SHRM-CP, PHR a plus


Benefits:
* **No-Cost Medication**: Get your prescribed compounded medications at no cost, ensuring your health without the financial burden
* **Onsite Health & Wellness – IV Therapy Drips:** Rejuvenate with complimentary onsite IV Therapy drips, enhancing your well-being and energy levels
* **Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision Options:** Choose from three medical plans tailored to your needs, plus options for dental and vision coverage for you and your family
* **Telehealth visits:** Access board-certified Doctors anytime, anywhere for you and your family
* **Paid & Volunteer Time Off:** Enjoy paid time off for personal pursuits and contribute to causes you care about with volunteer time off
* **Paid Holidays (8 scheduled; 2 floating):** Celebrate with eight scheduled holidays and two floating holidays, giving you flexibility and time for personal traditions
* **Life & AD&D Coverage:** Secure your and your family's financial future with life and accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D) insurance
* **FSA (Flexible Spending Account):** Manage healthcare expenses smartly with pre-tax dollars in a Flexible Spending Account (FSA)

title: Human Resources - HR Manager
description:
**Summary:**  

The HRM will serve as a strategic business partner for our globally expanding organization. This position will provide leaders with HR support in the areas of organizational structure, change management, employee relations, performance management and enforcing company policies and practices.
  
  

This is a remote position, with an expectation of 30% travel.

* Consults with managers, supervisors and team leads, providing HR guidance when appropriate. This includes problem resolution support in dealing with performance management, employee relations issues and organizational changes.

* Manages the talent acquisition process, which may include recruiting, interviewing and assisting with the hiring of qualified job applicant.

* Partner with business unit leaders to assess strategic needs and establish department priorities.
* Works closely with management and employees to improve work relationships, build morale and increase productivity and retention.
* Communicate and promote HR initiatives to assigned business units to ensure that initiatives are being utilized consistently and effectively throughout the organization.

Heated and air-conditioned office

title: Manager-Employee Relations (Primarily Remote, North Carolina Based)
description:
The Employee Relations Manager provides responsive customer service to Alliance employees in all areas of Human Resources with a primary focus on employee relations, performance management, and policy and procedure administration. Employee will work independently as well as with the HR team and Human Resource leadership to assist in implementing and maintaining a comprehensive HR program.


**This position is primarily full-time remote. Selected candidate must reside in North Carolina and be willing to travel to the home office (Morrisville, NC)** **or other office locations** **for Employee Relations needs and other onsite meetings as needed.**

**Responsibilities and Duties**



Manage Employee Relations


* Manage employee disciplinary process to ensure applicable procedures are followed and documentation is appropriate, accurate and timely
* Manage employee complaint and grievance processes in accordance with applicable procedures, conduct investigations as required and handle associated appeals through to closure
* Assist with ADA process ensuring an interactive process with both the employee and respective department regarding the ADA reasonable accommodation request(s)
* Conduct mediations and/or facilitated conversations to help resolve conflict
* Assist in legal matters related to employee relations to include information gathering, investigations and representing Alliance at related hearings when needed
* Work closely with Legal Department on review of various actions such as dismissals, approved/denied accommodations and other sensitive matters to ensure proposed actions are legally defensible


Performance Management


* Lead performance management efforts including monitoring employee and leader progress throughout the performance review and goal planning cycles
* Provide HR communications regarding timeline and process to keep employees informed and develop resources and trainings to assist in the processes
* Provide updates and data as requested to HR leadership


Policies/Procedures


* Review, research, and assist in policy development and modification, and draft policy recommendations ensuring updated laws/regulations are included, including those subject to substantial equivalence guidelines
* Provide guidance to employees with policy/procedure interpretation and ensure they are followed appropriately


Manage and Develop Staff


* Work with the Director of Human Resources to recruit and retain a highly qualified and well-trained workforce
* Ensure staff are well trained in and comply with all organization and department policies, procedures, and business processes
* Organize workflows and ensure staff understand their roles and responsibilities
* Ensure the department has the needed tools and resources to achieve organizational goals and to support employees and ensure compliance with licensure, regulatory, and accreditation requirements
* Actively establish and promote a positive, diverse, and inclusive working environment that builds trust
* Ensure all staff are treated with respect and dignity
* Ensure standards are transparent and applied consistently, impartially, and ethically over time and across all staff members
* Work to resolve conflicts and disputes, ensuring that all participants are given a voice
* Set goals for performance and deadlines in line with organization goals and vision
* Effectively communicate feedback and provide ongoing coaching and mentoring to staff and support a learning environment to advance team skills and professional development
* Cultivate and encourage efforts to expand cross-team collaboration and partnership


General HR


* Manages HR records according to area of responsibility by ensuring files are updated, accurate and properly documented in accordance with recordkeeping requirements
* Participate in new employee orientation
* Ensure employees and leaders have appropriate training and materials to assist with processes related to area of responsibility
* Manage Unemployment Insurance matters ensuring requests for information are handled timely and investigated if necessary
* Assist in developing, implementing, and administering relevant HR programs and initiatives that meet current needs while also anticipating future business and talent trends
* Understand, apply, and maintain thorough knowledge of employment laws such as ADA and subsequent amendments, FLSA, Title VII, HIPAA, and other related regulations/laws

  

  

**Minimum Requirements**



Bachelors degree from an accredited college or university in Human Resources, Business Administration, Psychology, or related field. Four (4) years of experience in Human Resources with a primary focus on employee relations to include experience with coaching/discipline, performance management, conflict resolution, and policy development.


**Preferred:** Experience working in Human Resources for State of Local Government in North Carolina, supervisory experience, and HR Certification strongly preferred.

  

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**


* Knowledge of Performance Management practices
* Knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations
* Knowledge of Human Capital Management systems
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Organizational skills and attention to detail
* Time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines
* Analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to prioritize tasks and delegate tasks when appropriate
* Interpersonal and conflict resolution skills
* Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality
* Microsoft Office Suite


**Salary**



Estimated Hiring Range: $86,800 to $105,000/Annually



Exact compensation will be determined based on the candidate's education, experience, external market data and consideration of internal equity.



An excellent fringe benefit package accompanies the salary, which includes:


* Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Long and Short Term Disability
* Generous retirement savings plan
* Flexible work schedules including hybrid/remote options
* Paid time off including vacation, sick leave, holiday, management leave

Preferred* Bachelors or better in Human Resource Management

Preferred* Associate PHR
* HR Professional-Certified

title: Manager, Labor & Employee Relations
description:
**The SPLC is seeking a Labor & Employee Relations Manager who is committed to supporting social justice!**
===========================================================================================================



The Labor and Employee Relations Manager will be forward-thinking and committed to the mission of Southern Poverty Law Center (SPLC) that recognizes staff as its most important resource. They will have the demonstrated ability to connect, build bridges and work collaboratively to develop, plan and implement employee relations practices. The Labor and Employee Relations Manager will handle issues involving bargaining unit and non-bargaining unit employees. They will also ensure that labor relations matters and activities are conducted in a manner consistent with SPLC's labor relations and legal strategies, operational and strategic business objectives, and values. They will work to nurture a transparent and collaborative workplace and uphold the values of justice, equity diversity and inclusion.


### **Who You Are**


**Credible & Trusted.** Skilled in establishing credibility throughout the organization with management and employees to be an effective listener and problem-solver of people issues. Adheres to strict confidentiality to maintain integrity and trustworthiness.


**Problem-Solver.** Ability to objectively coach employees and management through issues that may be complex, difficult and emotional. Ability to make recommendations to effectively resolve problems or issues by using judgment that is consistent with policies, regulations, and government law.


**Knowledgeable.** Working knowledge of multiple human resource disciplines including employee relations, performance management, compensation practices, performance management, federal and state respective employment laws.


**Communicative.** Regularly communicates with organizational and departmental leadership and employees. Exceptional interpersonal, teamwork and collaboration skills. Skilled in oral and written communication.


**Proficient.** Demonstrated experience working in HRIS systems and case management software.


**Mission, Vision & Culture Alignment.** Demonstrated awareness for SPLC's mission and vision; and a commitment to ideals of justice, equity, diversity and inclusion and fostering an anti-racist work culture and antiracist principles and learning.


### **What You'll Do**


**Provide** timely investigation summaries for all completed investigations and manage assigned employee complaints.


**Conduct** scheduled office visits and provides actionable feedback as needed.


**Ensure** compliance with the Collective Bargaining Agreement (CBA) and manage the grievance process in accordance with the CBA.


**Monitor** employee climate to identify issues/trends; recommends proactive solutions based on business needs/best practices and counsels Leadership on identifying issues and implementing corrective actions.


**Perform** exit interviews and analyzes data, making recommendations to the management team for corrective and continuous improvement.


**Manage** and support managers in performing semi-annual and annual employee performance reviews.


**Develop** and delivers HR related management training.


**Support** managers in the development and review of performance improvement plans and corrective actions, including termination requests and related documentation.


**Assist** management with the application and interpretation of human resources policies, compensation, benefits, performance problems, transfers, terminations and promotions.


**Support** SPLC's justice, equity, diversity and inclusion (JEDI) strategic plan.


**Support** implementation of HR programs into the business insuring an effective, sustainable people strategy over the long term.


**Maintain** and coordinate employee recognition and retention programs.


**Perform** other duties as required or assigned which are reasonably within the scope of the duties in this job classification.


### **Minimum Qualifications**


*We are committed to equitable hiring practices; therefore you must meet the minimum qualifications to be considered for the role.*


* Minimum of five (5) years of experience in Human Resources;
* At least three (3) years of conducting human resources related investigations in a unionized environment and managing the grievance process in a unionized environment;
* SHRM-CP or PHR preferred; and
* High School Diploma or GED.

### **Compensation & Benefits**



This is an exempt role and the minimum starting salary is $94,793 annually. Salary will be commensurate with experience.



Click here to view the benefits available to SPLC staff.


### **Where & How You'll Work**



This role the following work designations options:


* **Local Remote:** Will work remotely, but is expected to attend work-related activities that occur at the SPLC offices or in the states in which the SPLC operates.
* **Telework:** Will work at an SPLC office at least three days per week and may work two days per week from an alternative work location.
* This position reports to the Deputy Director of Labor & Employee Relations.

### **Other Special Considerations**



This job is performed under general office conditions and is not subject to any strenuous physical demands or dangerous conditions.



This role is expected to travel up to 20%.

  


### **Disclaimer:**



The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the employee in this position. These statements are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of a person in this position.


### **An Equal-Opportunity Employer with a Commitment to Diversity**


*Southern Poverty Law Center (SPLC) is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and as an organization committed to diversity and the perspective of all voices, we consider applicants equally without regard to age, caregiver status, color, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender expression, gender identity, marital status, national origin, on the basis of genetic information, political affiliation, pregnancy, or veteran status.*

title: Network HR Manager
description:
About the Position  

The Network Human Resources Manager will be responsible for, but not limited to, the overall leadership, oversight and coordination of all HR functions at the sites within their scope of responsibility. The Network HR Manager will provide oversight and assistance to locations within their scope of responsibility in achieving their HR goals, oversight of their sites, and serve as a daily contact for the HR Generalist / Administrator at each location.



Location: Chattanooga, TN or Remote



Functions  

Employee Relations: ·

* Manage employee relations practices necessary to maintaining a positive employee – employer relationship, promoting a high level of employee commitment and maintaining a union free status.
* Counsel and advise employees, managers, and business leaders regarding people, policies, workforce, organization, and employee issues.
* Facilitate a positive employee relations strategy which includes appropriate engagement and training activities
* Manage and resolve employee relations issues by conducting effective, thorough and objective investigations

* Proficient in Microsoft Office including Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.

* Ability to read and interpret safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.
* Ability to read and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures and government regulations.
* Ability to solve practical problems and difficult situations.
* Ability to speak effectively before groups, customers or employees of the organization.
* Must be able to read, write and speak English fluently.
* Ability to work a flexible schedule.
* Ability to travel as required based on the needs of the business.
