title: Human Resources Manager
description:
MRO Supply ( www.mrosupply.com )


Established in 1898, MRO Supply and its family of companies has been delivering high quality products to the manufacturing and distribution industries. Last year was our biggest year ever with $50MM+ in total revenue! Not bad for a company of around 40 employees! With over 1.5 million products to sell in categories including Electro-mechanical, Gearbox, Bearings, Chains, Sprockets, Motors, Cutting tools, and safety products and an exciting commission plan, it’s no wonder why many of our sales people have been happily with us for 10-20 years. Through acquisitions and product development, we’re adding new products lines and thereby opening up new markets and territories every year so it’s not surprising that our sales have been growing 20%+/year for the past 5+ years. At this time, we are hiring experienced Human Resources Manager to join our growing team. The Human Resources Manager will report to the CFO. Our family of companies continues to expand through acquisition and, as such, we are adding businesses and employees in states across the US with regularity. At this time, standardizing processes and building out robust employee training modules including onboarding are a high priority. The ideal candidate will have a wealth of experience in the area of SOP development and employee training development in addition to an HR generalist background.


**About the opportunity**

The Human Resources Manager will champion and provide expertise in support of an employee-oriented, high-performance culture, emphasizing safety, quality, productivity, and empowerment. The role will be responsible for the development of processes and reporting metrics that support the achievement of MRO’s business goals. The ideal candidate will have broad generalist experience in Human Resources in the areas of employee and labor relations, performance management, talent development, talent acquisition, and succession planning. This individual must be able to work in a fast-paced environment and have the ability to navigate and deliver amidst changing priorities and ambiguous circumstances.


The ideal candidate for this role should possess a positive outlook, high work ethic, excellent communication skills, knowledge of labor regulations and HR practices, strategic thinking abilities, strong organizational skills, and excellent interpersonal skills. An exceptional Human Resources Manager should improve HR processes, implement strategies that support business growth, improve morale and employee retention, enhance safety and wellness, strengthen relations between staff and leadership, manage job satisfaction, attract the best talent, and promote the organization's values.


**Who you’ll work with**

Reports to: CFO
  

Direct Reports: Build a team and grow a team under you


**Where you’ll be based**

Home office: Remote


**How you’ll make an impact**

**Training and Onboarding**

* Develop and implement employee onboarding program for new hires, enhancing the culture by aligning on-boarding processes with MRO’s guiding values and behaviors
* Conduct trainings as needed
* Guide the onboarding process to ensure acclimation to the company for new hires with 30/60/90-day probationary evaluations
* Train all new hires on code of conduct, benefits, policies, and HR procedures
* Train management population on anti-harassment policies and diversity

Coach hiring managers on effective interviewing skills


**HR Operations**

* Serve as the company’s HR leader and HR business partner, this includes proactive planning, coaching, and solid HR generalist expertise
* Develop and drive organizational effectiveness on all major initiatives; develop a strategic HR plan and prioritize and implement key HR initiatives and policies in a timely manner
* Ensure fairness and accuracy and HR documentation
* Consult, advise, and counsel, as needed, with leadership, on employee relations issues to ensure fair and equitable treatment of all associates and management staff
* Create and maintain position descriptions for all roles in key areas to ensure role clarity across functions
* Coordinate recognition programs and assist with celebrations and tracking of employee milestones and successes
* Oversee the hiring and separations processes – reviewing all applications, employment offers, and terminations prior to finalizing
* Process all exit interviews and separation agreements

**Talent Development**

* Oversee recruitment, talent assessment, employee development, and succession planning to ensure internal growth and development of all associates
* Work with managers to create employee development plans and goal setting – reviewing performance quarterly
* Evaluate and conduct staff annual performance evaluations and development process, coach the business leaders through the process for timely delivery
* Manage the performance improvement process ensuring effective coaching, proper documentation, timely follow up, and outcome (i.e., performance improvement or termination)

**Business Acumen**

* Have an interest and ability to know how the business works, analyze business trends, and integrate talent management initiatives to impact business performance
* Build credibility and influence cross-functional partners to achieve goals and maximize their teams and talent
* Formulate business strategies focused on retaining and developing key talent and reducing turnover
* Provide monthly reports and/or summaries of the business, employee performance and issues, and recruitment needs in areas of responsibility

**Talent Acquisition**

* Ensure appropriate recruiting and selection strategies, programs, systems, and metrics are developed and implemented to support the business needs
* Liaise with recruitment agencies as primary point of contact
* Ensure all recruitment needs are carried out in an efficient and cost-effective manner
* Build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates in all markets to effectively minimize the time required to fill open positions
* Review and partner on all employment offers

**What makes you qualified**

* Bachelor’s degree in human resources, business administration, or related field required, master’s degree preferred
* 5+ years of broad HR generalist experience, including a minimum of 2 years in a management position
* Experience successfully partnering with leadership to develop and implement human resources strategies
* Experience developing and implementing talent acquisition strategies that support a continuous talent pipeline, including the development of retention and employee satisfaction initiatives for skilled labor
* Experience managing and transitioning third party recruiting relationships and vendor relations
* Experience developing relationships with government sponsored entities; experience working with government grants, programs, and agencies to support employee recruiting and retention efforts
* Strong business acumen and the ability to partner effectively at every level of the organization
* Exudes confidence and assertiveness, takes a forceful stand on issues that support a logical, sound business plan
* Strong analytical and critical thinking skills; ability to extract, analyze, and present business insights in a clear, concise manner
* Strong project management and time management skills
* Effective communication skills - written, verbal, and listening skills

**What working here offers**

A highly competitive compensation package with an attractive base salary as well as a short-term incentive program. Work from your home office, or anywhere for that matter. We are a company with a demonstrated history of promoting from within and an impressive growth story. As we continue to grow both organically and through acquisitions, you will have an opportunity to build out this department and team and grow your personal portfolio along the way.


Job Type: Full-time


Salary: $80,000.00 - $125,000.00 per year


Benefits:


* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:


* Monday to Friday

Experience:


* Microsoft Office: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:


* Professional In Human Resources (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: HR Manager / Remote
description:

Manager to lead and oversee our HR department. The HR Manager will play a critical role in ensuring our
  

company's adherence to all Federal and local labor regulations across the country, specifically focusing
  

on the Service Contracts and Davis Bacons Acts. Additionally, the HR manager will be tasked with

contracts, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and adherence to relevant labor laws and contractual

title: Manager, Human Resources (Remote)
description:
Description:  

Help grow, develop and retain an expanding, virtual team of professionals who are motivated by daily opportunities to improve the safety, quality, accessibility and equity of health care. Health Quality Innovators (HQI) is seeking a positive, energetic, SHRM-certified HR generalist who performs routine “must-do” tasks and higher-level strategic work with equal enthusiasm.


HQI is multi-faceted and you must be, too. We are a non-profit organization that competes for government contracts and are increasing the services we offer directly to health care providers. While we currently maintain a small physical office, our more than 60 team members are permanently home-based in 10 states across the country. Last fall, we implemented a matrix organizational structure; we have a cadre of rising leaders climbing a new career ladder. Our team member development team has made some great updates to existing HR programs and is eager to work with you to formalize a leadership development program.


As HR Manager, you will play a key role in HQI’s growth by coordinating the sourcing, vetting, hiring and onboarding talent, as well as ensuring our continual compliance with federal employment laws and requirements (e.g., Service Contract Act). Other responsibilities include proactively managing compensation and benefits, training and assisting managers with team member (employee) relations, monitoring employment law and updating HR policies as needs arise (e.g., workplace COVID-19 vaccination requirements), administering the performance evaluation process, coordinating internal training and education. This position reports to the President & Chief Executive Officer and serves on the HQI leadership team.


HQI is a seven-time winner of the Best Places to Work designation, most recently in 2022. This is a terrific opportunity for an HR professional who enjoys being a working manager to join an organization that is always learning and improving. In addition, because this is a remote position, you will have the flexibility that comes with working from home.

 **About Health Quality Innovators (HQI)**


HQI is a non-profit health care quality consulting organization that has improved care delivery, patient safety and outcomes for millions of people since 1984. Many of our services are funded by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services and other federal health agencies. We work with hospitals, nursing homes, physician practices, public health agencies, community groups, stakeholder organizations, and patients and family members that want to make sustainable change.


Our team members are energized by opportunities to reduce avoidable harms, improve population health, make health care more equitable, and align technology with care delivery. The HQI culture values creativity, teamwork and integrity as essential elements of producing excellent work. We believe in the importance of work/life balance and actively support professional growth. HQI offers a friendly, respectful and collaborative work environment that allows team members to bring their real selves to work every day.


Requirements:  

a) Five to seven years’ experience in progressively more responsible HR positions.


b) PHR credential, SPHR credential is a plus.

  

c) Bachelor’s degree in human resources, business administration or a related field.

##### **d) Excellent interpersonal communication skills, including the ability to be a productive remote worker, manage competing priorities, coach team members, and advise managers. Excellent written communication and oral presentation skills.**

  

e) Strong ability to interpret data and use Microsoft Office tools. Proficiency using and maintaining an HRIS.

  

Competitive salary and attractive benefit package that includes a 401 (k) matching program, a monthly technology allowance and generous tuition reimbursement. We maintain a drug free workplace and are a M/F Disabled and Vet/EEO/AA Employer. Go to www.HQI.solutions/careers to apply.

title: Researcher
description:
Job Title: BA4- Research  

Location: Mumbai


About Barclays  

Barclays is a British universal bank. We are diversified by business, by different types of customers and clients, and by geography. Our businesses include consumer banking and payments operations around the world, as well as a top-tier, full service, global corporate and investment bank, all of which are supported by our service company which provides technology, operations and functional services across the Group.


Risk and Control Objective  

Take ownership for managing risk and strengthening controls in relation to the work you do.


Working Flexibly  

We’re committed to providing a supportive and inclusive culture and environment for you to work in. This environment recognises and supports ways to balance your personal needs, alongside the professional needs of our business. Providing the opportunity for all our employees, globally to work flexibly empowers each of us to work in a way that suits our lives as well as enabling us to better service our customers’ and clients’ needs. Whether you have family commitments or you’re a carer, or whether you need study time or wish to pursue personal interests, our approach to working flexibly is designed to help you balance your life. If you would like some flexibility, then please discuss this with the hiring manager, and your request will be reviewed subject to business needs


Hybrid Working


Structured hybrid role:  

At Barclays, we offer a hybrid working experience that blends the positives of working alongside colleagues at our onsite locations, together with working from home. We have a structured approach where colleagues work at an onsite location on fixed, ‘anchor’, days of the week, for a minimum of two days a week or more, as set by the business area (or nearest equivalent if working part-time hours). Please discuss the working pattern requirements for the role you are applying for with the hiring manager. Please note that as we continue to embed our hybrid working environment, we remain in a test and learn phase, which means that working arrangements may be subject to change on reasonable notice to ensure we meet the needs of our business.  

  

Introduction


The purpose of this role is to support the Commodity Research team by gathering relevant data and performing analysis in an efficient and timely manner to help come up with a differentiated viewpoint for our clients.


1. Improve and maintain existing oil supply models  

2. Assist the senior analyst in developing models for other geographies, increasing research coverage


What will you be doing?  

* Gathering and organizing data meaningfully to analyze and evaluate trends for relevant commodity (energy)
* Building or Updating various databases and models maintained by the team
* Analyzing and evaluating trends (demand, supply, prices, flows, etc)
* Writing-up ongoing updates and contributing to research publications
* Keeping track of relevant news reports on major markets
* Generating files/analyses for client requests
* Summarizing our latest views and insights into marketing presentations for the senior analyst's client meetings
* Working with the team to generate new ideas as well as produce and publish research reports
  

  

What we’re looking for:

* Contribute to a supportive and proactive working culture by sharing knowledge and expertise with other team members and providing training to colleagues when necessary.

* Excellent communication skills: must interact professionally with Client Servicing Managers and internal stakeholders via phone or email.

* In depth knowledge of Global KYC policies and procedures

description:
**Date:** Mar 6, 2024


**Location:** Pune, IN


**Company:** AkzoNobel


We supply the sustainable and innovative paints and coatings that our customers, communities – and the environment – are increasingly relying on. Our world class portfolio of brands – including Dulux, International, Sikkens and Interpon – is trusted by customers around the globe. We’re active in more than 150 countries and have set our sights on becoming the global industry leader. It’s what you’d expect from a pioneering paints company that’s committed to science-based targets and is taking genuine action to address globally relevant challenges and protect future generations.


For more information please visit www.akzonobel.com.


© 2023 Akzo Nobel N.V. All rights reserved.

  


**Job Description:**

  


**1.** **P****urpose/Key Objectives of the Job**

  


To mature and enhance its service offering, Master Data Management (MDM) Services has set up Global MDM capabilities into its Global Business Services organization. The Master Data Operations Steward for Legal & Integrity will be part of the Master Data Services Operations team and will be executing master data maintenance processes within SLAs, including its controls. The Master Data Steward will also be responsible for the master data maintenance of e-banking users and bank mandate holders in a central repository, ensuring that this information is complete and up to date through interacting with respective stakeholders.to manage access of users of external banking system, creating and maintaining authorizations of the users in the banking system. The Master Data Steward plays an active role in improving the data maintained in the legal entity and bank account management system (LEBAM).

  


**2.** **R****esponsibilities**


* Update data on bank mandates in the central repository based on the documents provided.
* Keeping the central repository comprising consolidated list of bank mandates and e-banking users always up-to-date and accurate.
* Contribute towards the improvement of process around maintenance of the repository of bank mandate holders and e-banking users.
* Support in preparing and providing various (template) reports from the repository to the treasury team and other stakeholders as needed.
* Process for access to electronic banking systems to business users within adhered SLA and escalate to Team Lead in case of any exceptions.
* Act as first point of contact for troubleshooting of errors/ issues faced by business users in relation to their access(es).
* Conduct root cause analysis for the recurring escalations and errors reported in process and ensure to execute CAPA (Corrective Action & Preventive Action) for errors identified.
* Support the implementation of master data quality rules and master data definitions.
* Support L&C Team Lead on process standardization and optimization in order to increase the process efficiency.
* Pro-active follow-up to business users with regular updates on requests from Requesters.
* Support Team Lead and Operations Manager for strategic decisions related to process.
* Support Team Lead with specific process related tasks, Root cause analysis, Audit, Reporting, etc.
* Master data maintenance with respect to legal entities such as changing statutory directors, banking accounts and banking mandates
* Support Team Lead with preparing (template) reports for various stakeholders within the organization;
* Assessing legal documents on reliability
* Preparing control reports for control of bank accounts
* Set up and manage user accounts of LEBAM
* Periodically performing data quality reviews
* Reporting on required changes in banking systems
* Manage issue fixing with business key users and IM support
* Support other activities as needed of treasury & insurance team as may be agreed from time to time
* Build working relationships and foster communication with internal customers within and across organizational and geographic boundaries

  




**3.** **J****ob Requirements**


Essential educational qualifications, relevant experience and requested skills.

  


* Graduation/ post-graduation in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, or equivalent work experience
* Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in a shared service centre with experience in MDM/ SAP domains or legal & compliance related functions
* Basic understanding the concept of legal entities and corporate structures, bank account management, banking operations and security and previous experience working on ServiceNow is highly preferred.
* Experience in implementation of services in a Shared Services environment preferred
* Experience/ knowledge of banking systems and compliances is preferred.
* Experience in complex business environments with multiple stakeholders, including service providers for both IT as organizational/process capabilities
* Strong knowledge of Excel tool
* Strong communicator and change agent
* Proactive approach in recognizing needs, solving problems, anticipating issues and developing solutions
* Self-motivated, pro-active and results driven
* Keeps deadlines and produces high quality output
* Manage dialogue with support functions and key stakeholders
* Customer Service mindset with excellent customer service skills.
* International mind-set – sensible for cultural differences

  


At AkzoNobel we are highly committed to ensuring an inclusive and respectful workplace where all employees can be their best self. We strive to embrace diversity in a context of tolerance. title: Financial Analyst
description:
Job Title: Analyst |Mumbai Financial Control
Location: Mumbai
About Barclays
Barclays is a British universal bank. We are diversified by business, by different types of customers and clients, and by geography. Our businesses include consumer banking and payments operations around the world, as well as a top-tier, full service, global corporate and investment bank, all of which are supported by our service company which provides technology, operations and functional services across the Group.
Risk and Control Objective
Take ownership for managing risk and strengthening controls in relation to the work you do.
Working Flexibly
We’re committed to providing a supportive and inclusive culture and environment for you to work in. This environment recognises and supports ways to balance your personal needs, alongside the professional needs of our business. Providing the opportunity for all our employees, globally to work flexibly empowers each of us to work in a way that suits our lives as well as enabling us to better service our customers’ and clients’ needs. Whether you have family commitments or you’re a carer, or whether you need study time or wish to pursue personal interests, our approach to working flexibly is designed to help you balance your life. If you would like some flexibility, then please discuss this with the hiring manager, and your request will be reviewed subject to business needs
Hybrid Working
Onsite role:
Colleagues who perform ‘onsite’ roles will spend four or five days a week working onsite, depending on the requirements of their role and business area. Please discuss the working pattern requirements for the role you are applying for with the hiring manager. Please note that as we continue to embed our hybrid working environment, we remain in a test and learn phase, which means that working arrangements may be subject to change on reasonable notice to ensure we meet the needs of our business.
Introduction:
This role is responsible for preparation of financial accounts to for the bank / subsidiaries in India. This role requires an individual to correctly interpret accounting standards alongwith regulatory guidelines and ensure that Barclays India branches are compliant with all guidelines when reporting financial information in the books and to the regulator. This role also requires appropriate oversight on the team managing the reporting to ensure all submissions are managed on a timely basis. In addition this role would require face off with the various auditors as and when queries are raised or audit is conducted.
What will you be doing?
This role requires the person to be aware of accounting and RBI regulations requiring reporting from Finance end. In depth knowledge of application of interpretation from Local GAAP requirement.
To be able to perform closure of books of accounts including preparation of the Balance Sheet and Profit and Loss Account
Review and challenge of the data and supplementary analysis submitted by different teams;
Liaison with external statutory and regulatory, concurrent and internal auditors to ensure clean and seamless audits
Oversight and ownership of the risk and controls framework for Financial Control function including documentation of these controls and monitoring and review to ensure the controls are operating effectively
Responding to ad-hoc information requests from RBI and senior management
Review and analyse the impact of new regulations on various reporting requirements
Review the rollout of new products with reference to impact on financial/ regulatory reporting
Preparation of the monthly reporting packs for senior management;
Provide necessary information to regional office around KPIs and Regulator communication
Good communication skills and analytical skills.
Preparation of Business Requirement Document to incorporate all logics.
Key Accountabilities
1. Understanding of regulations and timely & accurate Local GAAP reporting.
2. To be able to close books of accounts including preparation of the Balance Sheet and Profit and Loss Account
3. Liaison with external statutory and regulatory, concurrent and internal auditors
What we’re looking for:
* Qualified Chartered Accountant with experience of regulatory reporting


* To be well versed with the Accounting Standards and RBI circulars


* Strong control mindset


* Strong stakeholder engagement skills and understanding their requirements for effective execution


* Strong interpersonal skills and excellent communicator. Desire to provide top quality service to internal stakeholders from different areas of the firm /geographies


Skills that will help you in the role:
Accounting Standards, RBI regulations knowledge and Tax knowledge
Where will you be working?
Mumbai

Be More at Barclays
At Barclays, each day is about being more – as a professional, and as a person. ‘Be More @ Barclays’ represents our core promise to all current and future employees. It’s the characteristic that we want to be associated with as an employer, and at the heart of every employee experience. We empower our colleagues to Be More Globally Connected, working on international projects that improve the way millions of customers handle their finances. Be More Inspired by working alongside the most talented people in the industry, and delivering imaginative new solutions that are redefining the future of finance. Be More Impactful by having the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects, and Be More Valued for who you are.
Interested and want to know more about Barclays? Visit home.barclays/who-we-are/ for more details.
Purpose, Values and Mindset

We deploy finance responsibly to support people and businesses, acting with empathy and integrity, championing innovation and sustainability, for the common good and the long term.
Our values underpin everything we do: Respect, Integrity, Service, Excellence and Stewardship.

Respect
We harness the power of diversity and inclusion in our business, trust those we work with, and value everyone's contribution.
Integrity
We operate with honesty, transparency and fairness in all we do.
Service
We act with empathy and humility, putting the people and businesses we serve at the centre of what we do.
Excellence
We champion innovation, and use our energy, expertise and resources to make a positive difference.
Stewardship
We prize sustainability, and are passionate about leaving things better than we found them.

Our Mindset shapes how we take action, living by our Values, driven by our Purpose, always with our customers and clients at the heart of what we do; our Mindset is to Empower, Challenge and Drive.

Empower
Trust and support each other to deliver. Make decisions with those closest to the topic. Include diverse perspectives. Celebrate success and learn from failure.
Challenge
Question whether things can be done better. Use insights based on data to inform decisions. Be curious about how we can adapt and improve. Speak up and be open to alternative viewpoints.
Drive
Focus on outcomes. Deliver with pace. Be passionate and ambitious about what we do. Take personal responsibility. Actively build collaborative relationships to get things done.

About Winntus Formworks:  
Winntus Formworks is a prominent player in the construction industry, specializing in providing innovative formwork solutions for various projects. We are committed to excellence in all aspects of our operations, including our human resource management practices. As an organization, we value the skills and discipline that ex-servicemen bring to the workplace, and we are dedicated to providing them with meaningful career opportunities.

Job Description:

Winntus Formworks is seeking a dynamic and experienced Human Resource Officer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in HR management, with a focus on recruitment, employee relations, and personnel administration. Ex-servicemen are encouraged to apply, as we recognize and appreciate their unique skill set and work ethic.

Responsibilities:

* Oversee the recruitment process, including sourcing candidates, conducting interviews, and facilitating the selection process.
* Coordinate new employee onboarding and orientation programs to ensure a smooth transition into the organization.
* Manage employee relations issues, including conflict resolution, disciplinary actions, and grievance procedures.
* Administer employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other fringe benefits.
* Maintain accurate records of employee attendance, leave balances, and other relevant HR data.
* Develop and implement HR policies and procedures in accordance with company guidelines and applicable laws and regulations.
* Conduct training and development programs to enhance employee skills and knowledge.
* Assist in performance management processes, including goal setting, performance evaluations, and career development planning.
* Handle administrative tasks related to HR operations, such as preparing employment contracts, updating employee handbooks, and managing HR-related documentation.
* Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in HR management and make recommendations for continuous improvement.

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or related field.
* Proven experience in HR management, preferably in the construction or manufacturing industry.
* Strong knowledge of employment laws and regulations.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with employees at all levels of the organization.
* Solid organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.
* Proficiency in MS Office applications and HRIS software.
* Experience working with ex-servicemen is a plus.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, along with opportunities for career growth and development. If you are a motivated and proactive individual with a passion for HR management, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at Winntus Formworks.

title: Cbg:centre Head
description:
**About Commercial Banking Group:**



The Commercial Banking Group is responsible for delivering One Axis to clients with a turnover between Rs 10 Crs. to Rs 250 Crs. by offering products & solutions around forex, trade, payments, cash management and tax payments along with retail products like salary, trust services, forex, commercial card, credit cards etc


**About the Role:**



The Commercial Banking Centre Head, leads a team of Relationship Managers responsible for driving the commercial banking business for the centre. The Commercial Banking business focuses on working capital related facilities for clients – mainly letters of credit, guarantees, trade loans, etc. along with products such as Trade & Forex solutions & Cash Management Solutions


**Key Responsibilities**


* Develop business relationships with Commercial Banking customers in the area to increase the top line, fee income and net interest income of the Bank
* Achieve targets set for individual products like Working Capital (WC), Bank Guarantee (BG), LC (Letter of Credit), OD (Over Draft), DOD (Demand Overdraft), Trade Forex, TOD etc.
* Establish and strengthen relations with key customers to enhance credit relationships and generate sustained business.
* Identify and convert potential customers who can be sold tailored products to enhance product penetration
* Deepen the existing relationships by cross selling liability and asset products to new and existing customers
* Maintain a healthy portfolio and monitor the delinquency rates of the portfolio
* Ensure optimal limit utilization by the clients
* Monitor proposals that come up for renewal be a Part of sanctioning process including LCC
* Interact/ Liaise with various other departments to ensure smooth delivery of credit as well as other services
* Ensure audit related deliverables, both internal and external are met as per the prescribed norms
* Ensure compliance with due processes and guidelines
* Create a performance oriented environment leading to high employee motivation and productivity
* Ensure that all staffing requirements of the center are met and adequate training is given to the staff on the products of the bank, sales processes and various policies of the bank


**Qualifications:**



Optimal qualification for success on the job is:


* Graduation/Post-Graduation from a recognized institute


**Role Proficiencies:**



For successful execution of the job, the candidate should possess the following:


* Knowledge of credit, banking products and services
* Ability to manage complex client situations
* Good communication (both verbal and written) and presentation skill
* Ability to handle pressure and meet deadlines
* Good networking and relationship building skills

In Europe, BNP Paribas has four domestic markets: Belgium, France, Italy, and Luxembourg. The Group is rolling out its integrated commercial & personal banking model across several Mediterranean countries, Turkey, and Eastern Europe. As a key player in international banking, the Group has leading platforms and business lines in Europe, a strong presence in the Americas as well as a solid and fast-growing business in Asia-Pacific. BNP Paribas has implemented a Corporate Social Responsibility approach in all its activities, enabling it to contribute to the construction of a sustainable future, while ensuring the Group's performance and stability

  



Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

  


At BNP Paribas, we passionately embrace diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where all employees are valued, respected and can bring their authentic selves to work. We prohibit Discrimination and Harassment of any kind and our policies promote equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants, irrespective of, but not limited to their gender, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, colour, national origin, age, religion, social status, mental or physical disabilities, veteran status etc. As a global Bank, we truly believe that inclusion and diversity of our teams is key to our success in serving our clients and the communities we operate in.

Directorship / Registration:

  


Position Purpose

  


* Associate will be managing the daily operations/workflow within the business group and helps the Line Manager in achieving the process deliverables.
* Preferably accounting / commerce & financial management background.
* He/ She will be responsible for interacting with Line Managers and the clients of BNP Paribas Group and needs to provide high quality of service to the internal/ external clients.
* Regular interaction with the Team Lead/ Assistant Manager of BAU reconciliation for improving the quality of reconciliation produced to business.
* He/ She should be able to articulate well and communicate well across all levels in the organization.
* Ensure all the transactions are performed within the agreed timelines without errors and mistakes.
* Maintain Communication Channels with internal peer groups and business teams.
* Ensure to be updated with the procedure document and User Guides. Evaluate and update documented procedures to ensure they are complete, accurate and current.
* Accountable to follow the BCP / BIA documents
* Escalate unresolved open items to the Team lead / Assistant Manager.


§ Understand the process risks and escalation of high-risk breaks to stakeholders for resolutions.

  


**Responsibilities**

  

**Direct Responsibilities**  


**Primary Responsibilities**  

* Handling the reconciliation process and related activities for Clearing and Custody Services/ Investment Fund Services/ Middle Office Position business respectively.
* Identifying missing balance, trial balance, proof difference and resolving all variances to reach resolution in a timely manner.
* Performing a range of daily, weekly, monthly & quarterly reconciliations across all the business lines.
* Performing a range of daily, weekly, monthly & yearly controls to ensure feeds & related net transactions are in place
* Providing user training as required, improving the understanding of the control aspects of Intellimatch within the business.
* Investigating any open breaks and work with business team and any external parties for resolution.
* Identifying the reconciliation deviation/ backlogs in terms of process and having the discussion with BAU Manager to execute the correction process via BAU team.
* Escalate unresolved open items to the Team lead / Assistant Manager.
* Should gain knowledge in various Swift Message Types, especially MT940/950 and MT535/536 and ensure to understand the details available in these messages.
* Analyzing the details/ references received in MT940/950 and MT535/536 and liaise with correspondent banks and custodians in order to improve auto matching in Intellimatch.
* Track and maintain all the issues arising in the process and adhere to proper escalation matrix for resolution.
* Ensure all the process changes are discussed with team and tracked in the tracker appropriately.
* Identify the possibilities and create various rules to increase the percentage for the automatic matching process in Intellimatch.
* Responsible for the internal integrity of the automated reconciliation via Intellimatch..
* Maintaining the static data in Intellimatch databases including new accounts set-ups, department setup, matching rules, and other static data.
* Liaising with other departments to ensure aged breaks are properly commented with the current status and resolved in timely manner.
* Handling all types of rejects batches and formatting the files as per the requirement of Intellimatch. Manual import of files via Recollector
* Defining references in the lookup table to automate assignments and avoid discrepancies in Intellimatch.
* Liaising with IT for any discrepancies or changes in the flat files received for import.
* Maintain Communication Channels with internal peer groups, within GSO and with spoke locations.
* Participate in Brain Storming Sessions and share the best practices and ideas with the peer groups and team members.

  


**Primary Working Relationships**  

* The Candidate will report to the Process Lead/Assistant Manager of the process.
* Actively participate in all huddles and internal meetings.
* The position interacts with other Process Associates, Mid Office Staff, Relationship Managers and Clients.
* The position interacts with International Team Members of BNP Group.

  


**Contributing Responsibilities**  


* Working together with Lisbon, Mumbai & Chennai to achieve the vision of SSC.


* Work closely with stakeholders to mutually enrich the quality of process and to encourage collaborative efforts in achieving client satisfaction.
  


**Technical & Behavioral Competencies**

  


§ College Degree, preferably a Master’s degree in Commerce or MBA (Finance)

§ Strong verbal and written English skills required. Ability to converse clearly with internal and external staff.

§ Strong analytical skills, detail orientation, service commitment, and solid organizational and interpersonal skills.

§ Ability to work independently, as well as in a team environment, prioritizes multiple tasks, and meets strict deadlines.

§ Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications and strong MS-Word & Excel skills required.

§ To be based in Chennai & Mumbai and prepared to travel if required.

§ Must be prepared to work in any shift supporting business Requirements.

§ Identify Operational Risk Areas within the Client Business Revenue Process.  


**Client Focus & Adaptability:**  

**Client Focus:**  


* Be pro-active in developing customer relations by understanding and responding to customer needs.
* Strive continually for customer satisfaction and focus on Client Delight.

  


**Adaptability:**  


* Always look for ways to improve services and processes
* Be able to adapt to different markets and different clients evolution
  


**Integrity, trust & fairness**

  




* Acts with integrity in all interactions with colleagues, team members and clients.
* Promises only what can be delivered, managing expectations and honors commitments, and, has committed to ethical practices in all interactions and relationships.
* Treats others fairly, showing respect and courtesy.
* Builds trust by responding openly, genuinely and consistently to others.

Based on its strong diversified and integrated model, the Group helps all its clients (individuals, community associations, entrepreneurs, SMEs, corporates and institutional clients) to realize their projects through solutions spanning financing, investment, savings and protection insurance. BNP Paribas has implemented a Corporate Social Responsibility approach in all its activities, enabling it to contribute to the construction of a sustainable future, while ensuring the Group's performance and stability

  



Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

  


At BNP Paribas, we passionately embrace diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where all employees are valued, respected and can bring their authentic selves to work. We prohibit Discrimination and Harassment of any kind and our policies promote equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants, irrespective of, but not limited to their gender, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, colour, national origin, age, religion, social status, mental or physical disabilities, veteran status etc. As a global Bank, we truly believe that inclusion and diversity of our teams is key to our success in serving our clients and the communities we operate in.

  


About Business line/Function:

  


As part of BNP Paribas Asset Management's investment operations reporting and performance analysis team, the business line focuses on delivering comprehensive insights and assessments crucial for informed decision-making and client satisfaction. Operating within the investment operations domain, our team plays a pivotal role in scrutinizing and interpreting investment performance metrics, portfolio analytics, and market trends. We diligently monitor asset allocation, risk exposure, and compliance standards to ensure alignment with strategic objectives and regulatory requirements. By leveraging advanced analytical tools and methodologies, we aim to provide accurate, timely, and actionable performance reports to both internal stakeholders and external clients, facilitating transparency and trust in our investment strategies and outcomes. Our function encompasses a dynamic blend of quantitative analysis, data management, and strategic collaboration across various departments to uphold the highest standards of operational excellence and client service within the asset management landscape.

Senior Associate

  


Date:

Position Purpose

  


BNP Paribas Asset Management is the investment management arm of BNP Paribas, one of the world’s major financial institutions. Managing and advising EUR 580 billion in assets as at 31 March 2017, BNP Paribas Asset Management offers a comprehensive range of active, passive and quantitative investment solutions covering a broad spectrum of asset classes and regions. With close to 700 investment professionals and 600 client servicing specialists, BNP Paribas Asset Management serves individual, corporate and institutional investors in 75 countries around the world. Since 2002, BNP Paribas Asset Management has been a major player in sustainable and responsible investing.

  



Staff would be assigned a set of clients /per investment team to each team member. Each team member will be owner of the production end to end of all types and frequency of reports. To ensure the reliability and consistency of the final reports, you will take part to daily calls coordinating the data readiness, involving all key contributors. You will perform the defined set of controls during the production process, collect required contributions (comments, risk data,…) and track the workflow process to deliver the reports within deadline.



You will be in charge of documenting issues encountered during the production to ensure upstream controls are reinforced over time by the data.

  


**Responsibilities**

  

**Direct Responsibilities**  


* Production of performance attribution reports – explaining the relative out- or underperformance of a portfolio versus its benchmark


* Production of the client investment reports


* Collection of different contribution needed for final reporting and co-ordinate with the different teams involved


* To monitor the client deadlines of the reports


* To control and ensure the quality of the produced reports


* To highlight issues and act accordingly to have them resolved


* To document issues encountered during the production process


* To work together with Reporting Solutions teams to implement new reports and processes in the production

  


**Contributing Responsibilities**
* Reporting Solutions team


* Reporting Data team


* Different Investment Operations teams (Mandate Accounting, Portfolio Events Co-ordination, Pricing Team …)
  


**Technical & Behavioral Competencies**

  


* High quality (university) degree level of education (finance-oriented discipline).
* Good knowledge of asset management processes and financial products
* Notions of Performance Measurement are a very strong plus
* Past experience in reporting will be highly appreciated
* Operational background

* Fast learner with an analytical mindset
* Results Driven
* Collaboration, communication & interpersonal relations
* Client and results driven
* Good IT skills (proficiency in Excel, VBA is a plus).
* Excellent spoken and written English language skills.

title: Alliance Manager
description:
**WHO WE ARE**  

Come grow with us! If you are a passionate change agent who thrives in a collaborative, entrepreneurial and inclusive, culture committed to operational excellence, we would like to meet you.  

  

At Resonance, immediate hands-on experience alongside our clients as we work to build sustainable, positive impact. Our teams are autonomous and self-sufficient. You get to weigh in with founders and leaders on how to drive change and grow the movement while growing the company.  

  

Resonance is an award-winning, Certified B Corporation consultancy that delivers market-based solutions to address the world's toughest challenges. We enable a variety of donor, commercial, and investor clients around the world to catalyze lasting impact. Resonance seeks to catalyze large-scale social, environmental, and economic change by fostering new and dynamic forms of collaboration. We do this by fostering public-private partnerships, facilitating sustainable investment, and providing deep analytical insights in frontier markets.
**POSITION MANDATE**
The CIRCLE Alliance: Catalyzing Inclusive, Resilient, and Circular Local Economies is a public-private initiative to reduce plastic use and tackle plastic waste. Founded by Unilever, USAID, and EY, its aim is to support women entrepreneurs, improve livelihoods, and protect the environment by accelerating the development of a circular economy for plastics. CIRCLE will build on the successful approaches developed as part of impact enterprise accelerator TRANSFORM and by USAID’s Save Our Seas Initiative. CIRCLE will work across three key areas: developing a circular economy for plastics through grants funding and business consulting to social enterprises, supporting effective and transparent mandatory extended producer responsibility (EPR) policies and implementation, and advancing gender equality and women’s economic empowerment.
CIRCLE is seeking a Country Coordinator for India. The Country Coordinator will lead country-level project implementation, with an emphasis on creating a steady pipeline of SMEs, grantee selection; coordination with and between grantees, partner governments, and CIRCLE members organizations; and oversight. The Country Coordinator will partner with the Grants and Program Manager, Women’s Economic Empowerment (WEE) Advisor, USAID AOR and Mission Activity Managers, the Unilever Project Leads and Country/Regional Leads, and key points of contact at EY to engage with grantees to identify priority acceleration needs and develop Tailored Acceleration Packages (TAPs), which are designed to strengthen business operations, gender inclusive practices, sales, etc. Engagement with Unilever may also include engaging with third party suppliers and helping targeted small and medium enterprises (SMEs) pursue opportunities to engage within the Unilever supply chain. The Country Coordinator will likewise lead the selection and management of local capacity builders and specialized short-term technical assistance resources when required. Lastly, the Country Coordinator will serve as an in-country point of contact for grantees, providing grant monitoring support and fostering cross-grantee collaboration and learning.
This is a full-time position based in Mumbai, India reporting to the Chief of Party. This position is expected to be hybrid and will align with Unilever office mandates.  


**OUTCOMES / ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**
* Serves as the CIRCLE Alliance’s country representative and partnership liaison to USAID Mission, Unilever, and EY in-country teams; participates in country, regional and global coordination meetings as required.
* Supports Alliance member in-country teams with the development of grantee pipelines, which includes collaborating with in-country peers, leveraging entrepreneurship ecosystems through extended networks, identifying viable grantees within the SME ecosystem, and representing the Alliance at in-person or virtual grants information sessions.
* Supports the successful implementation of award and grants management processes, including engaging in the solicitation, pre-award risk assessment and due diligence, evaluation, implementation, communication, MEL/reporting/tracking, and closeout.
* Manages grants evaluation and selection committee processes and chairs their respective country-level committee.
* Maintains an understanding of USAID programming and grants, with emphasis in ensuring grants are well administered and implemented in compliance with donor regulations and Resonance policies and procedures.
* Maintains responsive and clear communications with the CIRCLE COP, WEE Advisor and Grants and Program Manager on grants and grantee-related activities to ensure timely and responsible implementation of activities, as well as troubleshooting and remediation as needed.
* Ensures integration of gender equality and women’s empowerment priorities across the activity, including grant administration and implementation.
* Supports grantees with grant and financial management, milestone reporting, specific conditions compliance as part of the capacity building component, and general guidance.
* Provides technical and management inputs into contractual and technical reporting needs of USAID, Unilever, and other applicable partners.
* Conducts field monitoring visits to grantee locations to observe, understand, report, and improve the progress of grant project implementation, security protocols permitting.
* Oversees and coordinates in-country CIRCLE Alliance consultants (in Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR), MEL, WEE, Acceleration), including support to start-up assessments.
* Supports the design of scopes of work and manages local capacity builders engaged through the grants fund.
* As needed, provides targeted support to CIRCLE in the following areas: workshop logistics and facilitation, work planning, training, and assessments.
* Engages with host government as needed to communicate delivery of CIRCLE with prior consultation with the CIRCLE COP and partners.


  

**REQUIRED EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE**
* Master’s degree in international relations, public administration, business administration, natural resource management, or another relevant field and 5 years of experience; or a bachelor’s degree and 7 years of experience.
* Minimum of 3 years of project management experience on a USAID-funded project and/or donor-funded project, including proven experience managing and supporting the full grants cycle and providing grants and/or subaward oversight.
* Minimum 2 years of experience directly advising SMEs and/or social enterprises or designing and overseeing implementation of programming supporting social enterprises in India.
* Proven experience working in one or more of the following technical areas: WEE, EPR, circular economy or solid waste management.
* Working knowledge of Microsoft software packages: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook.
* Fluent in English and Hindu reading and writing.

**PREFERRED EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE**
* Experience in facilitation and meeting/workshop design and coordination.
* Strong networks with the SME ecosystem within India.
* Prior public-private partnership experience
* Prior experience working for both donor and private sector clients
* Prior experience and expertise in solid waste management
* Prior experience implementing projects with gender equality and women’s empowerment components


  

**TRAVEL EXPECTATIONS**  

The employee must be able to travel domestically up to 20% for work assignments.
**WORK ENVIRONMENT & PHYSICAL DEMANDS**  

This position operates in a professional office environment, and routinely requires the use of standard office equipment such as computers, phones, printers, photocopiers, and filing cabinets.  

  

The physical requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
As a part of the responsibilities for this job, the employee is required to communicate, detect, converse with, discern, convey, express oneself, and exchange information orally and in writing with others. The employee must be able to remain in a stationary position, sitting at a desk for prolonged periods, move or traverse inside the office and facilities; operate, activate, use, prepare, inspect, place, detect, or position computers and other office equipment, such as a calculator, copy machine, furniture, and computer printer. The employee must be able to make substantial repetitive motions of the wrists, hands and fingers. The employee must be able to lift and move up to 15lbs at times.  


**AAP/EEO STATEMENT**
The Equal Employment Opportunity Policy of Resonance is to provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all associates and job applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity or expression, and sexual orientation) parental status, genetic information (including family medical history) political affiliation, military service, age, veteran status, disability, or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. These protections extend to all management practices and decisions, including recruitment and hiring, appraisal systems, promotions, training, and career development programs. Consistent with these obligations, Resonance also provides reasonable accommodations to employees and applicants with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs, observances, and practices.
Resonance believes that employees should be provided with a working environment which enables each associate to be productive and to work to the best of his or her ability. We do not condone or tolerate an atmosphere of intimidation or harassment based on any of the above-mentioned characteristics.
We expect and require the cooperation of all employees in maintaining a discrimination and harassment-free atmosphere.
**Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. No phone calls or emails please.**

title: Immigration Specialist
description:
**Summary**
-----------


We are seeking a knowledgeable and detail-oriented Immigration Specialist to join our team. The Immigration Specialist will be responsible for managing various aspects of immigration processes, ensuring compliance with US- India Immigration laws and regulations, and providing support to employees and clients navigating the immigration process.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------


Case Management: Handle end-to-end immigration processes for employees including visa applications, work permits, residency permits.


Documentation: Prepare and review immigration-related documents, forms, and applications accurately and in compliance with legal requirements.


Compliance: Stay updated on changes to US- immigration laws, regulations, and procedures to ensure compliance and mitigate risks for the organization and its employees.


Communication: Serve as the primary point of contact for employees, clients, and external stakeholders regarding immigration-related inquiries, updates, and requirements.


Relationship Management: Build and maintain relationships with government agencies, legal counsel, immigration consultants, and other external partners to facilitate smooth immigration processes.


Advisory Services: Provide guidance and support to employees and clients on immigration matters, including visa options, eligibility criteria, processing times, and potential challenges.


Data Management: Maintain accurate records and databases of immigration cases, documentation, and correspondence to ensure completeness and accessibility.


Training and Education: Conduct training sessions or workshops for employees and managers on immigration policies, procedures, and best practices.


Problem Resolution: Address and resolve issues, delays, or complications related to immigration processes promptly and effectively, escalating complex cases as necessary.


Reporting: Generate reports and metrics on immigration activities, trends, and compliance metrics to support decision-making and compliance efforts.

**Requirements**
----------------


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Law, International Relations, Human Resources, or a related discipline. Advanced degree or certification in immigration law or related field preferred.


Proven experience working as an Immigration Specialist, Immigration Consultant, or similar role, with a deep understanding of US immigration laws and regulations.


Strong knowledge of visa categories, immigration procedures, and documentation requirements for various countries.


Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with individuals from diverse backgrounds and cultures.


Attention to detail and accuracy in document preparation and case management.


Familiarity with immigration software, databases, and tools for case management and compliance tracking.

* Hands-on approach
* Success in creating, driving and program managing effective development, employee relations, retention and reward programs
* Enthusiastic team player with a drive to create a positive work environment
* Ability to identify problems and drive appropriate solutions independently


The HR Partner will be supporting multiple technology and Corporate Ops groups . The individual will be responsible for HR Partnering, managing employee life cycle processes, driving performance management, coaching and developing managers, driving analysis on key HR metric, driving automation ideas and self-service mechanisms, as well creating engagement & retention framework for employees.
  
* Partner w/ business on workforce planning and skills assessment
* Review and analyze business unit data to identify trends and recommend solutions to improve performance, retention, and employee experience
* Work with line managers and employees to address employee relations issues
* Implement/administer/interpret corporate policies/programs/procedures
* Plan, manage and provide continuous improvement to all aspects of the client organization and leadership review process and the strategic objectives therein. This includes both annual and mid-year processes which focus on performance management and talent development.
* Partner with managers to retain, develop and motivate people to achieve their fullest potential.
* Provide compensation support including salary planning, approval of salary actions, promotions and job re-leveling


We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
  
  

Bangalore, KA, IND | Hyderabad, TS, IND
  
  

* Proven understanding of the role and functions of a human resource office within a corporate operations structure
* Proven ability to prioritize tasks and to organize workload to ensure that programs are driven as per plan
* Experience and specific knowledge of human resource theory, functions and practice; performance management systems and employee development
* Exposure to talent analytics - ability to create reports and analyze employee metrics
* Able to travel, as appropriate.
